alert.note: Alert for Caddo; De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN DE SOTO AND SOUTHWESTERN CADDO PARISHES...SOUTHERN HARRISON AND CENTRAL PANOLA COUNTIES THROUGH 830 AM CDT... At 800 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenwood to near Elysian Fields to 7 miles north of Tatum. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Carthage, Greenwood, Stonewall, Beckville, Deberry, Elysian Fields, Keachi, Grand Cane, Longstreet, Gloster, Keat Chie, Frierson, Front, Spring Ridge, Kingston, Darco, Midyett, Kickapoo, and Keithville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
